titles.title: Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug)(fols. 3ra-38va).

donors.donor: lәğ Gäbrä Ḥәywät (fols. 11ra, ls. 4-5, 24vb, ls. 9-10, 27va, l.7, 34va, ls. 3-4, 38va, ls. 1-2, 38va, ls. 11-12); Gäbrä Mäsqäl (fols. 11ra, l.5, 27va, ls. 6-7, 34va, l.4, 38va, l.1); Wälättä Yoḥannәs (fols. 11ra, l.7, 24vb, l.10, 27va, ls. 9-10, 34va, ls. 5-6, 38va, ls. 3-4); Wälättä Śәllase (fols. 24vb, l.11, 27va, l.10, 34va, 6, 38va, ls. 4-5); Wälättä Mäsqäl (fol. 27va, ls. 8-9); Wälättä Ṣәyon (fol. 34va, l.7); Wälättä Maryam (fol. 38va, l.6); ʾAmätä Ṣәyon (fol. 38va, l.5).

owners.owner: Currently, the book is in possession of Mәdrä Ruba Śәllase; however, a short note following the explicit of the Homily states that (initially) lәğ Gäbrä Ḥәywät donated the manuscript to the church of St. Mary of ʾAbaʿko. It seems to be one of several churches in the area which disappeared, but whose tabots and books were brought to the church of Mәdrä Ruba.

txstates.txstate: The threads of the binding are partly broken. Many leaves are damaged by humidity or worn (fols. 5r, 10r-12r, 17v-18r, 29v-36r) and by spots (fols. 5v-6r, 8v-11r, 15r, 23v-24v, 26v-27r, 29v).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards; two pairs of sewing stations.

txfolios.txfolio: Two cut leaves (not numbered), between fol. 1r and fol. 2r. Foliation mistake: number 37 is missing.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(4/fols. 35r-39v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ppunctuations.ppunctuation: Executed: not quite regularly. Usage: not always logical. Dividers: I. Colon; colon with short lines above and below (e.g. fols.: 7va, ls. 6, 9, 15, 16; 8ra, l.16; 8rb, ls. 7, 9; 9rb, l.3; 17rb, l.1; 18ra, ls. 5, 8; 22va, l.2; 22vb, ls. 2, 3, 5; 35ra, ls. 2, 4, 10, 11, 15). II. Four dot asterisk (e.g. fols.: 3ra, ls. 8, 10, 13; 3rb, ls. 2, 6, 9, 13; 3va, l.1; 10va, l.1; 12rb, l.5; 21vb, l.9; 34vb, ls. 2, 6; 38va, ls. 10-11); nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text). III. Long black line (esp. fol. 38va, l.13).

desccontent.text: I. Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
desccontent.mss: BN d´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.), fols. 80r-92v: “Sermon de Jacques de Saroug sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139). EMML no. 378 (1959/70), fols. 1r-23v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 93; Church of St. Gabriel, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 400 (late 19th cent.), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 624 (1908), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 885 (1916/30), fols. 3r-19r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1512 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-4v, 71rv, 100v-107r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 12; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1589 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-30v: “Dersāna sanbat, attributed to James of Sarug” (EMML V, 77; Private library of Dr. Abraham Demoz, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1656 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-22v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 141; Church of Dämṭa Giyorgis, Gubalafto, Wällo). EMML no. 1672 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-66r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gäbrä Mäsqäl Täsfaye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2190 (1779/1800), fols. 124r-137v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 302; Church of Miṭaq ʾAmanuʾel, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2323 (1923/24), fols. 3r-27r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 372; Church of ʾƎlqo Mädḫane ʿAläm, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2392 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 222r-228r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 463; Church of Miṭaq Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2726 (1775-1809), fols. 4r-5r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML VII, 117; Church of Ḥarr ʾAmba Yoḥannәs, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3200 (17th cent.), fols. 2r-4v, 5r-6v, 15rv, 17rv, 18rv, 20r-21r, 22r-23v: “Homily on the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat] ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML VIII, 150; Church of Sarya Mikaʾel, Zanǧira, Wärana Basso, Shoa). EMML no. 3341 (1755/69, 1769/96), fols. 48v-63v: “Homily of James of Sarug about Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 215; Church of Gädam Maryam, ʾAsagәrt, Shoa). EMML no. 3472 (18th cent.), fols. 146rv, 135r-145v, 147r-149v: “Homily of James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 286; Church of Gubbalafto Täklä Haymanot, Yäǧǧu, Wällo). EMML no. 3965 (20th cent.), fols. 2r-3v: “Homily by James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML IX, 256; Church of Laǧǧa Gәnd Giyorgis, Wärana Baso, Shoa). EMML no. 4017 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 122r-147v: “Homily by James of Sarug on the Christian Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Maryam, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4362 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-15r: “Homily on the (Christian) Sabbath [Dersāna Sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4435 (1891), fols. 182r-186r: “Homily on Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 152; Church of Sälla Dәnqay Marqos, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). Orient. 18, fols. 121r-138v: “Homilia Jacobi Sarugensis de Sabbatho” (DillmLond 22). StrRyMan 7 (17th/18th cent.), fols. 44v-49r: “Sermon of Jacob of Serug” (StrJRyM 14). StrANL Conti Rossini 71 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 62r-64v: “Sermon de Jacques de Seroug” (StrANL 188). TelAviv, Library Faitllovitch, 34 (18th cent.), fols. 1-28 (cp. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 344).

edition.text: ድርሳነ፡ ሰንበት፡ (Dǝrsanä sänbät, ‘Homily of the Sabbathʼ), ed. by ʾabba GÄBRÄ KIDAN BÄZZABBƎH – ʾaggafari GÄBRÄ IYÄSUS – MÄŠÄŠA GƎZZAW; Addis Abäba 1947 A.M. [1954/55 A.D.]; ibid. ed. by TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚƎLLASE, Addis Abäba 1959 A.M. [1966/67 A.D.]. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 343-61.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 3ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡ በእንተ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቅድስት። ዘደረሰ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት። ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ [vac.] ገብረ፡ ሕይወት። ወአዕማቲሃ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ [vac.] [fol. 3rb] ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ስምዑ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ በእንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ …
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the homily which ʾabba Jaqob of Serug composed on St. Sabbath of Christians, which the Orthodox in faith composed. May her prayer and her blessing be with Gäbrä Ḥәywät, and her maids Wälättä Śәllase … Forever and ever. Amen. Listen, I will tell you about her greatness and her glory…
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 38rb, l.12: … ወያድኅነኒ፡ ወለዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘጸሐፎ፡ ኅብኦ፡ እምሐከከ፡ ሰብእ፤ ወለአግብርቲከ፡ [fol. 38va]ገብረ፡ መስቀል፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወለአዕማቲከ፡ ወለተ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ አመተ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም፡ መሐሮሙ፡ ወአብኦሙ፡ ውስተ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘልጅ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ዘወሀባ፡ ለማርያም፡ አባዕኮ፡
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 38rb, l.12: …  May He save me; and for the one who wrote this book, hide him from the trouble of the people, (namely) your servants Gäbrä Mäsqäl, Gäbrä Ḥәywät, and your maids Wälättä Yoḥannәs, Wälättä Śәllase, ʾAmätä Ṣәyon, Wälättä Maryam. Have mercy upon them and bring them in the Kingdom of Heaven. Forever and ever. Amen. This (is) the book of lәğ Gäbrä Ḥәywät which he gave to the church of St. Mary of ʾAbaʿәko.

extras.extra: Crude notes in the margins and inside the text: e.g., fols.: 1r-2v, 6r, 16r, 23v, 30v, 34r, 34v, 38v-39v. Crude notes on the inner side of the back cover.
